revised_title: On the Movements of Flame in the Explosion of Gases: A Historical Review
tldr: This article provides a historical review of the study of flame movements and gas explosions. It discusses the works of various scientists, including Davy, Bunsen, Berthelot, and Le Chatelier, who contributed to understanding the rate of explosion, pressures, and temperatures produced in gas explosions. The article also highlights the importance of studying the movements of flames in gaseous explosions and the methods used to measure the pressures and temperatures produced.
